title: The issue with Face of the Mountain.
body:
Mid to late game, you will have some trouble to use your stacks due to the fact everyone oneshots minions or entire waves.
It's frustating to spend the successive 20ish minutes of games using like 8 charges out of 40. 


{{item:3401}} 
[...]
UNIQUE Passive - Spoils of War: ~~Melee~~ Basic attacks execute minions ~~below 200 Health~~. Killing a minion heals you and the nearest allied champion for 50 (+1% of your maximum Health) and grants them kill Gold.
[...]

replies.body: I've always wondered why the HP execute function does not increase in the item's build path.

It would be better if they added GpS and reduced stacks by 1.


This would give tanky supp more gold,but also reduce their healing in lane(for me,the heal is one of the most frustraiting things when facing tanky supps)

> It would be better if they added GpS and reduced stacks by 1.
> 
> 
> This would give tanky supp more gold,but also reduce their healing in lane(for me,the heal is one of the most frustraiting things when facing tanky supps)

I actually really like the balance of this item now and disagree with your suggested changes. If you poke intelligently, you can poke much more than a tanky support can heal off of the passive. If you're playing the tanky support, having sustain is really important to your viability in lane.

That said, the utility of this item goes down substantially in late game, apart from the shield. It's a tradeoff that isn't experienced by Talisman of Ascension or Frosqueen's Claim, so I agree with the OP that the full item utility should be maintained, even if it means reducing the amount of the heal or item +health to maintain game balance.

Actually, they all strike an interesting balance.

For FotM, you don't have to be anywhere for two full minutes. You do require some help afterwards, but honestly I find Threshes are pretty easily able to Flay a wave, etc., and get some gold back.

Meanwhile, anyone running Talisman will repeatedly miss out on gold if they roam during a minion wave.

Anyone with Frost Queen's isn't necessarily going to be in combat often enough to use all their GP10.

The benefit of Face here is that they can dump two minutes worth of stacks out with a little effort. I find that pretty fair.
but the amount of gold gained is considerably less compared to the other 2 items.

Mayn tanky supp use  alot of masteries from the defensive tree + item+pots ->the sustain becomes huge and there also the adc that has pots+lifesteal+targons heal

Im not saying im right or that you rae wrong,im saying my opinion.

[...]
UNIQUE Passive - Spoils of War: Melee Basic attacks execute minions below ~~200 Health~~. 200 health **+ .5%*level**

 Killing a minion heals you and the nearest allied champion for 50 (+1% of your maximum Health) and grants them kill Gold.
[...]

However I would like to point out that the sustain granted from that item path during the laning phase, is more than enough to negate most if not all of the harass, turning it into a battle of attrition, where you will probably lose by default first, if you spend too much mana to poke with.
Agree with you,maybe they should give GpS and reduced the max stacks by 1 at all lvls on the item?
I agree with this, the damage of your teammates late game makes it way harder to heal them with the passive

Maybe change the passive of the item to...

{{item:3401}} 

[...]
UNIQUE Passive - Spoils of War: Melee Basic attacks execute minions below ~~200~~ **350 (+1% of your maximum heath)** Health. Killing a minion heals you and the nearest allied champion for 50 (+1% of your maximum Health) and grants them kill Gold.
[...]
---
Maybe I'm over-exaggerating it a bit but then again this change could benefit better last hitting on support more effectively late game.

So I was playing around last night as tank graggy support and noticed something that might help you out with this issue. The passive is actually two statements/effects, both dependent on having a charge. The first effect is the obvious "Melee basic attacks execute minions below 200 Health." However if you read the second half of the statement "Killing a minion heals you and the nearest allied champion for 50 (+1% of your maximum Health) and grants kill Gold." You will notice that it does not state that EXECUTING a minion grants the heal and gold. I decided to test this out, and found that as long as your allies are near by they will still receive the gold and heal, which allowed for interesting barrel tricks. Of course each charge can only trigger off of a single minion, however you are able to trigger the second half of the passive at range with abilities, just not the execute. I hope this helps you gents (or ladies) and happy supporting!

People who play Thresh should know this already, hence why it's one of his 3 typically viable starts next to health crystal and Doran's Shield.

As for my 2-cents on the poor gold-gen of Relic Shield.  It's supposed to be the "safest" of the 3 support item trees, but I agree it trades off too much for this.  Perhaps if Targon's Brace gave a meager +1 gold/10, supports that choose this route wouldn't be constantly ending games 20-30% behind even the lowest income amongst your teammates.  Or even worse, with less gold than nearly the entirety of the opposing team, regardless of having earned a victory.

A. The safest of the three gold generating items is Ancient Coin, not Relic Shield.

B. You must only see supports who poorly manage their Spoils of War stacks, then. I'm mostly on part with my team goldwise when playing with the FotM-line.  
Remember, don't waste your stacks on ranged minions. Melee minions and especially cannons is where the big money is.
Why not make the execute scale with levels and %max hp? That would solve every problem.

agree, another option would be allowing spells to execute aswell with it(on face of the mountain, not relic or targons), so this items helps u with waveclear later on.
I think haveing it trigger only from AAs still wouldn't help to much, especially in a sieging situsation, as u want to clear waves as fast as posible from as far away as posibble, so ther still wouldn't be a minion reaching AA range for any melee support.

Totally agree, albeit this might make tanky support gold income (That's a mouthful) incredibly powerful and make them walls of meat late game. Which might be good or it might throw the balance out of wack.

Honestly, I think Thresh being unable to proc the execute is the only problem. I'm sure some other ranged-supports might pick it up if they removed the melee restriction, but it doesn't seem like it would break the item or make its popularity skyrocket (except on Thresh). If Thresh pokes the enemy, he loses his Flay stacks and therefore does far less basic attack damage while trying to last hit making it pointlessly more difficult. It just seems like an unfair trade off to have to choose between getting an easy last hit on that cannon minion to share the gold, or poke that nosey Braum and when you hit that minion it barely survives and gets killed by another (resulting on 0g and an annoyed ADC that will never trust you to last hit again). Try it in PBE, rito plz?
